snippet: A report cautioned that government wiretapping of the Internet could pose “serious security risks” to users.
abstract: Group of computer experts and cryptographers publish report arguing that Federal Bureau of Investigation's plan to intercept and monitor Internet audio and video chats could pose serious security risks to ordinary Internet users, giving thieves and foreign agents an easy way to eavesdrop without detection.
lead_paragraph: A report cautioned that government wiretapping of the Internet could pose “serious security risks” to users.

headline.main: Concerns Arise on U.S. Effort to Allow Internet ‘Wiretaps’
headline.print_headline: Concerns Arise on U.S. Effort To Allow Internet ‘Wiretaps’

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
